intro: Cicerbita cyanea, commonly known as the blue celandine, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and it often grows in moist, woodland areas. It is part of the Poppy family (Papaveraceae) and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Cicerbita cyanea is also noted for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic if ingested in large amounts.
